comments:
Build ID: I20070323-1616

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Have a working RCP app on 3.2
2. Download 3.3M6 (see build id), check out all your RCP code into the new Eclipse's WS, ensure any previously-known requirements are present (e.g., GEF) 
3. Run -- get the cryptic error message that means "somewhere you are missing a plug-in" 
4. Go to the launch config dialog, note that there is still no way to see what is missing (grr) and just click "Add Required" (get 15 more) 
5. relaunch -- get error log as attached 


More information:

Created an attachment (id=63380)
log of the error

Created an attachment (id=63386)
log of the same error in 3.3M5eh

My project requires Java 1.5, and despite setting that as the JRE in Eclipse 3.3 M5, asking for a Clean, etc., no rebuild takes place, and Eclipse 3.3M5 stubbornly insists that "parameterized types are only available if source level is 5" -- so, unlike 3.3M5eh and 3.3M6, I cannot test 3.3M5.

Notes: 

1) The allegedly missing class, AppConfigs, is not at all missing (and loads just fine under 3.2.1); I suspect the class-loader is barfing b/c of the earlier error. 

2) The main report has to do with the RCP not running, but new kinds of build warnings also appear, of which this one (e.g.) is mysterious and should be explained: "no valid properties files exist in the localization directory specified".

Further data, possibly relevant: 

Here is my old dependency-list (i.e., for 3.2), across all my plug-ins, of items from Eclipse: 

org.eclipse.core.expressions
org.eclipse.core.runtime
org.eclipse.help
org.eclipse.help.base
org.eclipse.help.ui
org.eclipse.help.appserver
org.eclipse.help.webapp
org.eclipse.ui
org.eclipse.ui.forms
org.eclipse.tomcat
org.apache.lucene

in addition, these are added to the launch config (may have omitted one -- no easy way to getthis list): 
com.ibm.icu
org.apache.ant
org.apache.ant.core 
org.eclipse.core.commands
org.eclipse.core.contenttype
org.eclipse.core.jobs
org.eclipse.core.variables
org.eclipse.equinox.common
org.eclipse.equinox.preferences
org.eclipse.equinox.registry
org.eclipse.jface
org.eclipse.osgi 
org.eclipse.swt (and the win32 fragment) 
org.eclipse.ui.workbench

plus the usual "compatibility" stuff 

I am using GEF (or at least draw2d), but I think the crash is occurring before any of that gets called

The error related to AppConfigs not loading is actually because while loading that class the system attempted to start the containing (or some other) bundle.  That failed so the class load failed.  That activation appears to have failed because of an NPE in/around the UI initializing preferences.  Summary, I don't think there is a particular migration issue here, perhaps it is just a bug?

Moving to the UI for investigation.  Adding DJ cause he likes preferences...

Tod:  one of the stacks buried in these logs indicates that it's possible that the UI preferences can be initialized before the display is created.  This means that the code that determines high contrast mode may not always work.   Is there a better place we can put this?
We should do this in the theme manager I think. This will also affect JDT so we should log a seperate bug

I was pointed to this bug from a post on the newsgroups, as it may be the cause of my issue.  

I am trying to upgrade my 3.3m5 version and after the last update (unfortunately not sure what plugins I updated  :(  ) now eclipse locks up 1/2 way through the progress bar on the splash screen.

The error from the log is listed below.

Any idea how to fix the startup issue?

Thoughts?

Andy:  can you try running eclipse from the command line and hitting ctrl-c when the lock happens and paste the resulting stacktrace here please?

I deleted my install and went with a more recent release cantidate, so I can not longer reproduce it.

Sorry :(

(In reply to comment #6)
> That activation appears to have failed
> because of an NPE in/around the UI initializing preferences.  Summary, I don't
> think there is a particular migration issue here, perhaps it is just a bug?

Paul, could you please launch your app in debug mode with an exception breakpoint for NullPointerException? That way, we might be able to make progress on this bug.

Using Eclipse 3.3M6, build id I20070323-1616, results not in an NPE this time, but a NoClassDefFoundError, for a class somewhere inside Eclipse (my code, still being developed on 3.2.1, build id M20060921-0945, has changed so I expect that explains the difference). The error log is being written to some location that I don't know, so I have copied it textually from Notepad when it is opened after the launch fails, below. 

When I launch in debug mode, set to break on NoClassDefFoundError (caught & uncaught), the debugger does not stop. 

Next ?

> resolved:"). The NoClassDefFoundError entry can probably be ignored.
> 
Very frustrating since this is code that runs under 3.2.1 ... so after trying to read a series of those log-files and add the required bundles one or two at a time, I finally managed to recall that I should simply, again, click "add required" in the launch config dialog -- and a total of 18 bundles were added. 

Then the launch goes back to failing with a normal ".log" file, alleging an NPE, as before. 

SO I try the debug launch, set to break on NPE -- and indeed the UIPreferenceInitializer.initializeDefaultPreferences() calls 
StartupThreading.runWithoutExceptions(new StartupRunnable() { ... }});
to set high-contrast, which assumes that there is a workbench, but the static Workbench pointer "workbench" in StartupThreading is in fact null, exactly as Kim Horne suggested in comment #7.

This should be fixed in M7 and later 3.3 milestones, see bug 183036.  Please reopen if I'm wrong.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 183036 ***
